caption:
This photograph depicts an environmental scene characterized by pollution and apparent neglect. At the forefront, there is a large, cluttered pile of trash occupying a significant portion of the landscape. The debris includes a variety of discarded items such as metal drums, broken household appliances, torn fabrics, and other indistinguishable rubbish. This aggregation of waste is positioned on a slope, suggesting it may be the edge of a landfill or an illegally dumped site.

Surrounding the trash pile, there is a dense forest, which introduces a stark contrast between the natural environment and the pollutants introduced by human activity. The trees are lush and green, which emphasizes the detrimental impact of the trash on the environment. The photograph is taken during daylight, and the lighting casts shadows across the debris, enhancing the textures and chaotic nature of the waste materials.

This scene powerfully conveys themes of environmental degradation and the challenges of waste management. The composition, focusing on the juxtaposition between the natural forest backdrop and the man-made waste, serves as a visual commentary on the intrusion of pollution into natural settings.
title: Dump beside lake road (5-27) near purvis.  Clay silt mixes with rusting cans
placename: Ozarks, Lake of the, State Park (Mo.)
location: Ozarks, Lake of the, State Park, Missouri
